labels.analysis: The Yunxiao DevOps Server is designed to facilitate seamless interaction between AI assistants and the Yunxiao platform for enhanced development collaboration. It primarily focuses on automating various aspects of the software development lifecycle, including code management, project tracking, pipeline execution, and package handling. The available tools are comprehensive and cover core DevOps functionality, enabling teams to manage source code, workflows, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines effectively. The server also supports user and organization management, as well as artifact and package management.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Development Tools" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around tools that aid in software development, version control, and CI/CD pipeline management. The secondary labels "Code Management" and "Project Management" are added because the server provides extensive capabilities in these areas. These labels accurately reflect the server's role in streamlining development workflows and enhancing team productivity, aligning with the predefined categories.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Yunxiao DevOps Server
server_info_crawled.author: @aliyun/alibabacloud-devops-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI assistants to interact seamlessly with the Yunxiao platform for enhanced development collaboration. Automate code management, project tracking, pipeline execution, and package handling to optimize workflows and boost team productivity. Simplify code reviews and task management to focus on innovation and product delivery.

tools.name: create_branch

tools.description: [Code Management] Get the CodeUp Repository List. A Repository serves as a unit for managing source code and is distinct from a Project. Use Case: View my repositories

tools.description: [Code Management] Get information about a change request

tools.name: list_change_requests

tools.name: create_change_request
tools.description: description workItemIds repositoryId* sourceBranch* targetBranch* organizationId* reviewerUserIds sourceProjectId targetProjectId create_change_request_comment

tools.description: [Code Management] Create a comment on a change request

tools.description: [Code Management] List comments on a change request

tools.name: list_change_request_patch_sets

tools.name: get_current_organization_info
tools.description: Get information about the current user and organization based on the token. In the absence of an explicitly specified organization ID, this result will take precedence.

tools.name: get_user_organizations
tools.description: Get the list of organizations the current user belongs to

tools.name: get_current_user
tools.description: Get information about the current user based on the token. In the absence of an explicitly specified user ID, this result will take precedence.

tools.name: get_project
tools.description: [Project Management] Get information about a Yunxiao project

tools.name: search_projects
tools.description: [Project Management] Search for Yunxiao Project List. A Project is a project management unit that includes work items and sprints, and it is different from a code repository (Repository). Use Cases: Query projects I am involved in Query projects I have created

tools.name: get_work_item
tools.description: [Project Management] Get information about a work item

tools.name: search_workitems
tools.description: [Project Management] Search work items with various filter conditions

tools.name: get_pipeline
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get details of a specific pipeline in an organization

tools.name: list_pipelines
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get a list of pipelines in an organization with filtering options

tools.name: smart_list_pipelines
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Intelligently search pipelines with natural language time references (e.g., 'today', 'this week')

tools.name: create_pipeline_run
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Run a pipeline with optional parameters

tools.name: get_latest_pipeline_run
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get information about the latest pipeline run

tools.name: get_pipeline_run
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get details of a specific pipeline run instance

tools.name: list_pipeline_runs
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get a list of pipeline run instances with filtering options

tools.name: list_pipeline_jobs_by_category
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get pipeline execution tasks by category. Currently only supports DEPLOY category.

tools.name: list_pipeline_job_historys
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get the execution history of a pipeline task. Retrieve all execution records for a specific task in a pipeline.

tools.name: execute_pipeline_job_run
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Manually run a pipeline task. Start a specific job in a pipeline run instance.

tools.name: get_pipeline_job_run_log
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get the execution logs of a pipeline job. Retrieve the log content for a specific job in a pipeline run.

tools.name: list_package_repositories
tools.description: [Packages Management] List package repositories in an organization with filtering options

tools.name: list_artifacts
tools.description: [Packages Management] List artifacts in a package repository with filtering options

tools.name: get_artifact
tools.description: [Packages Management] Get information about a single artifact in a package repository

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@aliyun/alibabacloud-devops-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: yunxiaoAccessToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Alibaba Cloud Yunxiao personal access token
